<task>
[Memory Bank: Active] Subtask: Implement robust GPU fallback for Jellyfin and small ops fixes based on the completed diagnostics and recovery.

Context and evidence
- Host access is restored for Sonarr/Radarr/Prowlarr/qBittorrent after recreating the rootless network; Gluetun is healthy with WireGuard egress verified.
- Jellyfin remains Created with runtime error: “crun: cannot stat `/usr/lib64/libEGL_nvidia.so.580.95.05`: No such file or directory”. This indicates GPU library injection/runtime mismatch even though devices exist. The wrapper currently detects NVIDIA devices and unconditionally selects GPU compose, but does not fallback when Jellyfin fails to start.
- maintenance/maintenance.sh incorrectly looks for repo-root .env; project standard uses [core/.env](core/.env:1) (see [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1)).
- Minor echo text drift in [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1) suggests legacy helper names (start.sh/logs.sh).

Scope (only these changes)
1) Add post-start Jellyfin verification and automatic fallback to the no-GPU compose in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1).
2) Fix environment file path check in [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1) to use core/.env.
3) Update “Useful commands” echoes in [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1) to point to supported helpers.

Do not modify any compose files. Do not change networking. No behavioral change for non-GPU paths beyond the fallback when GPU start fails.

Implementation details

1) Robust GPU fallback in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1)
- Keep the existing device-based detection, but after starting with GPU:
  - Wait briefly (e.g., 5–10s), then inspect Jellyfin:
    podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}} {{.State.Error}} {{.State.ExitCode}}'
  - If status != "running" OR ExitCode != 0 OR .State.Error contains “libEGL” or “cannot stat /usr/lib64/libEGL” (or is non-empty), treat as GPU start failure.
  - On failure:
    - Log a clear warning noting likely driver/CDI/lib mismatch and reference [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1).
    - Run a controlled fallback:
      podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml down
      podman-compose --env-file core/.env -f core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml up -d
    - After fallback, re-check Jellyfin status; log whether it is now running.
- Ensure all compose ups include “--env-file core/.env”.
- Guard against set -e causing premature exit: structure the post-start check and fallback so that failures in the check do not abort the script before attempting fallback.
- Emit clear INFO/WARN lines for:
  - GPU mode selected
  - Jellyfin status after GPU start
  - Fallback engaged or not
  - Final status summary

2) maintenance/maintenance.sh env path correction in [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1)
- Replace the repo-root .env check with core/.env.
- Update the remediation message to: “Create it from core/.env.example: cp core/.env.example core/.env”.

3) Echo text normalization in [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1)
- Replace legacy references:
  - “Start stack: ./start.sh” -> “Start stack: ./scripts/podman-up.sh”
  - “Check logs: ./logs.sh” -> “Check logs: ./scripts/podman-logs.sh”

Notes
- Do not alter compose files. Do not add/remove services. Keep the fallback strictly runtime-driven off Jellyfin’s state/error.
- Keep logs succinct and actionable; reference [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1) for users encountering recurring GPU issues.
- Ensure shell syntax remains POSIX-compatible and pass bash -n validation.

Testing (non-destructive)
- Do not start/stop the stack in this code task.
- Validate script syntax:
  bash -n scripts/podman-up.sh scripts/podman-down.sh maintenance/maintenance.sh
- Show the key new code blocks you added/modified with enough context lines.

Acceptance criteria
- After running ./scripts/podman-up.sh on a host where Jellyfin fails in GPU mode due to missing libEGL*, the script automatically falls back to [core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml](core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml:1) and Jellyfin proceeds to running state (CPU mode).
- The script’s console output clearly states fallback reason and final state.
- maintenance/maintenance.sh checks for core/.env and prints the correct remediation.
- scripts/podman-down.sh echoes reference the supported helpers.

Process requirements
- Start by using codebase_search to locate the relevant logic in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1) and the env check in [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1).
- Make minimal, focused edits as specified.
- Signal completion using attempt_completion:
  - List files changed with line ranges.
  - Summarize the logic added for GPU fallback and the exact conditions that trigger it.
  - Confirm syntax check passed.
  - Confirm echo/env path fixes applied.
These specific instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions your mode may have.
</task>

<content lines="1-89">
 1 | # Architecture
 2 | 
 3 | System overview
 4 | - Orchestrated with Podman Compose using a single compose file: [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1)
 5 | - Operational scripts for lifecycle:
 6 |   - Start: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1)
 7 |   - Stop: [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1)
 8 |   - Logs: [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1)
 9 |   - Systemd wrapper: [scripts/podman-systemd-wrapper.sh](scripts/podman-systemd-wrapper.sh:1)
10 | - Health and diagnostics:
11 |   - Health/maintenance: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1)
12 |   - Quick checks: [maintenance/quick-debug.sh](maintenance/quick-debug.sh:1)
13 | 
14 | High-level architecture
15 | ```
16 | ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
17 | │                         Media Stack (Podman)                    │
18 | │                                                                 │
19 | │   ┌────────────┐     ┌───────────┐     ┌───────────┐            │
20 | │   │  Prowlarr  │◄────│  Sonarr   │     │  Radarr   │            │
21 | │   │   9696     │     │   8989    │     │   7878    │            │
22 | │   └────────────┘     └───────────┘     └───────────┘            │
23 | │          ▲                        ▲                  ▲          │
24 | │          │                        │                  │          │
25 | │          │                        │                  │          │
26 | │          │                        │                  │          │
27 | │   ┌────────────┐      ┌──────────────────────────────────────┐  │
28 | │   │ FlareSolverr│      │            Jellyfin 8096            │  │
29 | │   │    8191     │      │  (GPU optional; transcoding cache)  │  │
30 | │   └────────────┘      └──────────────────────────────────────┘  │
31 | │                                      ▲                           │
32 | │                                      │                           │
33 | │                         ┌──────────────────────────┐             │
34 | │                         │      qBittorrent 8080    │             │
35 | │                         │  (network_mode:gluetun)  │             │
36 | │                         └─────────────▲────────────┘             │
37 | │                                       │                          │
38 | │                         ┌─────────────┴─────────────┐            │
39 | │                         │     Gluetun (AirVPN)      │            │
40 | │                         │  WireGuard + Port Fwd     │            │
41 | │                         └───────────────────────────┘            │
42 | └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
43 | ```
44 | 
45 | Key technical decisions
46 | - VPN-first networking
47 |   - qBittorrent runs with network_mode "container:gluetun" to enforce VPN routing at the container boundary.
48 |   - AirVPN WireGuard credentials are provided via environment variables sourced from core/.env.
49 | - Port forwarding
50 |   - Enabled through Gluetun and exposed to qBittorrent automatically; verification steps are documented in [docs/QUICK-REF.md](docs/QUICK-REF.md:1) and [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1).
51 | - Rootless-first
52 |   - Defaults target rootless Podman; optional rootful tuning is documented in [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1).
53 | - GPU support with boot reliability
54 |   - NVIDIA CDI preferred with a boot-time race-condition fallback implemented in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1) and documented in [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1).
55 | - Single source of truth
56 |   - One compose file [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1) drives all service definitions, volumes, and environment wiring.
57 | 
58 | Source/code and configuration paths
59 | - Compose: [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1)
60 | - Env templates: [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1), optional [core/.env.performance](core/.env.performance:1)
61 | - Scripts: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1), [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1), [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1), [scripts/podman-systemd-wrapper.sh](scripts/podman-systemd-wrapper.sh:1)
62 | - Maintenance: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1), [maintenance/quick-debug.sh](maintenance/quick-debug.sh:1)
63 | - AirVPN servers data (if used): [services/gluetun/servers.json](services/gluetun/servers.json:1)
64 | - Documentation entry points: [docs/README.md](docs/README.md:1), [docs/QUICK-REF.md](docs/QUICK-REF.md:1), [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1)
65 | 
66 | Component relationships
67 | - Prowlarr → Sonarr/Radarr: Indexers feed downstream apps
68 | - Sonarr/Radarr → qBittorrent: Download client over http://gluetun:8080
69 | - Bazarr → Sonarr/Radarr: Subtitle fetching using *arr API endpoints
70 | - Jellyfin → Media directories: Serves /movies and /tv-shows from host
71 | - qBittorrent → Gluetun: All qBittorrent traffic egress via VPN container
72 | - Gluetun ↔ AirVPN: WireGuard session, optional port forwarding
73 | 
74 | Critical implementation paths
75 | - First boot path
76 |   1) Copy envs: core/.env.example → core/.env
77 |   2) Start: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1)
78 |   3) Health: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1) health
79 | - Troubleshooting path
80 |   1) Quick triage: [maintenance/quick-debug.sh](maintenance/quick-debug.sh:1)
81 |   2) Logs: [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1)
82 |   3) VPN verification: podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec gluetun wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io
83 | - GPU boot fallback path
84 |   - Detection and fallback compose selection implemented in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1); behavior and rationale documented in [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1).
85 | 
86 | Security model
87 | - VPN isolation: qBittorrent cannot reach the WAN without Gluetun
88 | - Least privilege: Rootless Podman by default, optional rootful for performance
89 | - SELinux: Compose and docs include guidance for labeling and policy considerations (see [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1))
</content>

 1 | # Product: Media Stack with VPN
 2 | 
 3 | Why this exists
 4 | - Provide a private, automated home media pipeline that searches, downloads, organizes, and streams content through a VPN, with predictable setup and operations on modern Linux systems.
 5 | 
 6 | Problems it solves
 7 | - Privacy and IP exposure: All torrent traffic flows through a VPN gateway.
 8 | - Manual glue: Automates the end-to-end flow across multiple apps.
 9 | - Unclear networking: Standardizes Podman networking and port forwarding through a single VPN container.
10 | - Troubleshooting fatigue: Ships with unified health checks and logs workflow.
11 | 
12 | How it works (high level)
13 | 1) VPN entrypoint: Gluetun establishes an AirVPN WireGuard connection using static config values from AirVPN Config Generator, acting as the gateway.
14 | 2) Downloading: qBittorrent runs in network_mode "container:gluetun" so all its traffic is forced through VPN.
15 | 3) Indexers and automation: Prowlarr manages indexers and feeds Sonarr/Radarr; Bazarr handles subtitles.
16 | 4) Library and playback: Jellyfin serves media, with optional GPU acceleration.
17 | 5) Operations: Start/stop/logs via scripts and a single compose file.
18 | 
19 | Core deliverables
20 | - Single compose file: [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1)
21 | - Operations scripts: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1), [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1), [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1)
22 | - Health and debugging: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1), [maintenance/quick-debug.sh](maintenance/quick-debug.sh:1)
23 | - Documentation: [docs/README.md](docs/README.md:1), [docs/QUICK-REF.md](docs/QUICK-REF.md:1), [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1)
24 | 
25 | User experience goals
26 | - Fast first run: copy [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1) to core/.env and populate 4–5 AirVPN variables, then bring up the stack.
27 | - Clear daily operations: one health command, one logs command, one stop/start path.
28 | - Predictable recovery: deterministic restart and diagnostic capture when something goes wrong.
29 | - Secure by default: qbittorrent cannot leak traffic outside VPN; straightforward verification steps are documented.
30 | - Rootless-first with optional rootful optimizations: secure defaults, with documented trade-offs if maximum performance is required.
31 | - GPU-friendly: optional NVIDIA CDI support with a boot-time fallback for first-try reliability.
32 | 
33 | Primary user flows
34 | - First boot
35 |   - Configure AirVPN: copy [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1) → core/.env
36 |   - Start stack: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1)
37 |   - Verify health: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1) health
38 | - Normal ops
39 |   - Logs and checks: [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1), [maintenance/quick-debug.sh](maintenance/quick-debug.sh:1)
40 |   - Weekly updates: pull images and redeploy via compose or scripts
41 | - Troubleshooting
42 |   - Health script → targeted debug → service restart as needed
43 | 
44 | Scope
45 | - In scope: Podman-based orchestration, AirVPN + WireGuard via Gluetun, *arr suite, qBittorrent, Jellyfin, GPU acceleration (optional), health/diagnostics, and documentation.
46 | - Out of scope: Docker-specific deployment, cloud hosting, multi-user auth management, seedbox integrations beyond AirVPN.
47 | 
48 | Non-goals
49 | - No automatic WAN exposure for Jellyfin; leave remote access manual.
50 | - No Dockerfiles for custom builds; rely on upstream images.
51 | - No non-AirVPN providers in this baseline (extendable later).
52 | 
53 | Success criteria
54 | - Stack starts cleanly rootless on current Fedora/Ubuntu with Podman ≥4.0 using [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1).
55 | - qBittorrent always routes through Gluetun; external IP check differs from host.
56 | - Health workflow detects and guides remediation for 90% of common issues.
57 | - GPU systems start reliably on first boot with the documented fallback behavior.
58 | - All docs have valid internal references and consistent command paths (scripts/ and core/).
59 | 
60 | Key assumptions
61 | - Linux host with Podman + podman-compose available.
62 | - AirVPN account with WireGuard config generated (PrivateKey, Address values).
63 | - Storage directories exist: /media/Storage/{downloads,movies,tv-shows} bound into containers.
64 | 
65 | Reference docs
66 | - Start here index: [docs/INDEX.md](docs/INDEX.md:1)
67 | - Overview and quick start: [docs/README.md](docs/README.md:1)
68 | - Commands and checks: [docs/QUICK-REF.md](docs/QUICK-REF.md:1)
69 | - Podman details and trade-offs: [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1)
</content>

 1 | # Tech
 2 | 
 3 | Technologies used
 4 | - Containers and orchestration
 5 |   - Podman (rootless-first), podman-compose
 6 |   - Systemd user services for autostart
 7 |   - LinuxServer.io images for *arr suite and Jellyfin
 8 | - VPN and networking
 9 |   - Gluetun as VPN gateway with AirVPN + WireGuard
10 |   - Container network isolation using network_mode "container:gluetun"
11 |   - AirVPN static port-forwarding integration
12 | - GPU acceleration
13 |   - NVIDIA CDI (Container Device Interface) for Jellyfin
14 |   - VAAPI fallback via /dev/dri for Intel/AMD
15 | - Shell and tooling
16 |   - Bash scripts for lifecycle ops and maintenance
17 |   - SELinux compatible bind-mounts and labels
18 | 
19 | Development setup
20 | - Core compose and environment files
21 |   - Compose: [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1)
22 |   - Env template: [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1)

27 |   - Logs: [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1)

37 |   - GPU startup fix: [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1)
38 | 
39 | Technical constraints
40 | - Rootless-first model
41 |   - No privileged daemon; port bindings <1024 require mapping to high ports
42 |   - Certain sysctls unavailable; documented alternatives in [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1)
43 | - SELinux
44 |   - Use :Z/:z labeling on bind-mounts; see examples in [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1)
45 | - VPN isolation
46 |   - qBittorrent must run with network_mode "container:gluetun"; do not expose qbittorrent ports directly on host
47 | - GPU availability at boot
48 |   - Race condition mitigation implemented in [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1) and described in [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1)
49 | 
50 | Dependencies
51 | - Host
52 |   - Podman ≥ 4.x and podman-compose installed
53 |   - Optional: NVIDIA drivers + nvidia-container-toolkit for CDI
54 |   - Storage directories: /media/Storage/{downloads,movies,tv-shows}
55 | - AirVPN account
56 |   - WireGuard credentials from AirVPN Config Generator (PrivateKey, Address)
57 |   - Optional port forwarding enabled in AirVPN client area
58 | 
59 | Tool usage patterns
60 | - Operations
61 |   - Start/Stop via scripts for consistency:
62 |     - Start: [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1)
63 |     - Stop: [scripts/podman-down.sh](scripts/podman-down.sh:1)
64 |     - Logs: [scripts/podman-logs.sh](scripts/podman-logs.sh:1)
65 | - Health and verification
66 |   - First check: [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1) health
67 |   - VPN IP check: podman-compose -f [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1) exec gluetun wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io
68 | - Configuration workflow
69 |   - Copy [core/.env.example](core/.env.example:1) → core/.env; set AirVPN WireGuard and qBittorrent credentials
70 |   - Optional performance tuning with [core/.env.performance](core/.env.performance:1)
71 | - GPU boot reliability
72 |   - Automatic fallback to no-GPU compose variant if devices are unavailable; details in [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1)
73 | 
74 | Testing and validation
75 | - Compose validation
76 |   - podman-compose -f [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1) config
77 | - Service health
78 |   - [maintenance/maintenance.sh](maintenance/maintenance.sh:1) health then targeted checks (VPN, PF, services)
79 | - VPN routing correctness
80 |   - Ensure gluetun-reported IP differs from host and qbittorrent inherits same egress via network_mode
81 | 
82 | Notes for contributors
83 | - Follow rootless-compatible patterns unless a documented rootful optimization is required and justified in [docs/PODMAN.md](docs/PODMAN.md:1)
84 | - Keep single source of truth in [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1); prefer env indirection over hard-coded values
85 | - When updating docs, ensure all internal references use correct paths and clickable references to reduce drift

<file><path>.kilocode/rules/memory-bank/memory-bank-instructions.md</path>
<content lines="1-169">
  1 | #region Memory Bank
  2 | 
  3 | I am an expert software engineer with a unique characteristic: my memory resets completely between sessions. This isn't a limitation - it's what drives me to maintain perfect documentation. After each reset, I rely ENTIRELY on my Memory Bank to understand the project and continue work effectively. I MUST read ALL memory bank files at the start of EVERY task - this is not optional. The memory bank files are located in [`.kilocode/rules/memory-bank/`](.kilocode/rules/memory-bank) folder.
  4 | 
  5 | When I start a task, I will include `[Memory Bank: Active]` at the beginning of my response if I successfully read the memory bank files, or `[Memory Bank: Missing]` if the folder doesn't exist or is empty. If memory bank is missing, I will warn the user about potential issues and suggest initialization.
  6 | 
  7 | ## Memory Bank Structure
  8 | 
  9 | The Memory Bank consists of core files and optional context files, all in Markdown format.
 10 | 
 11 | ### Core Files (Required)
 12 | 1. `brief.md`
 13 |    This file is created and maintained manually by the developer. Don't edit this file directly but suggest to user to update it if it can be improved.
 14 |    - Foundation document that shapes all other files
 15 |    - Created at project start if it doesn't exist
 16 |    - Defines core requirements and goals
 17 |    - Source of truth for project scope
 18 | 
 19 | 2. `product.md`
 20 |    - Why this project exists
 21 |    - Problems it solves
 22 |    - How it should work
 23 |    - User experience goals
 24 | 
 25 | 3. `context.md`
 26 |    This file should be short and factual, not creative or speculative.
 27 |    - Current work focus
 28 |    - Recent changes
 29 |    - Next steps
 30 | 
 31 | 4. `architecture.md`
 32 |    - System architecture
 33 |    - Source Code paths
 34 |    - Key technical decisions
 35 |    - Design patterns in use
 36 |    - Component relationships
 37 |    - Critical implementation paths
 38 | 
 39 | 5. `tech.md`
 40 |    - Technologies used
 41 |    - Development setup
 42 |    - Technical constraints
 43 |    - Dependencies
 44 |    - Tool usage patterns
 45 | 
 46 | ### Additional Files
 47 | Create additional files/folders within memory-bank/ when they help organize:
 48 | - `tasks.md` - Documentation of repetitive tasks and their workflows
 49 | - Complex feature documentation
 50 | - Integration specifications
 51 | - API documentation
 52 | - Testing strategies
 53 | - Deployment procedures
 54 | 
 55 | ## Core workflows
 56 | 
 57 | ### Memory Bank Initialization
 58 | 
 59 | The initialization step is CRITICALLY IMPORTANT and must be done with extreme thoroughness as it defines all future effectiveness of the Memory Bank. This is the foundation upon which all future interactions will be built.
 60 | 
 61 | When user requests initialization of the memory bank (command `initialize memory bank`), I'll perform an exhaustive analysis of the project, including:
 62 | - All source code files and their relationships
 63 | - Configuration files and build system setup
 64 | - Project structure and organization patterns
 65 | - Documentation and comments
 66 | - Dependencies and external integrations
 67 | - Testing frameworks and patterns
 68 | 
 69 | I must be extremely thorough during initialization, spending extra time and effort to build a comprehensive understanding of the project. A high-quality initialization will dramatically improve all future interactions, while a rushed or incomplete initialization will permanently limit my effectiveness.
 70 | 
 71 | After initialization, I will ask the user to read through the memory bank files and verify product description, used technologies and other information. I should provide a summary of what I've understood about the project to help the user verify the accuracy of the memory bank files. I should encourage the user to correct any misunderstandings or add missing information, as this will significantly improve future interactions.
 72 | 
 73 | ### Memory Bank Update
 74 | 
 75 | Memory Bank updates occur when:
 76 | 1. Discovering new project patterns
 77 | 2. After implementing significant changes
 78 | 3. When user explicitly requests with the phrase **update memory bank** (MUST review ALL files)
 79 | 4. When context needs clarification
 80 | 
 81 | If I notice significant changes that should be preserved but the user hasn't explicitly requested an update, I should suggest: "Would you like me to update the memory bank to reflect these changes?"
 82 | 
 83 | To execute Memory Bank update, I will:
 84 | 
 85 | 1. Review ALL project files
 86 | 2. Document current state
 87 | 3. Document Insights & Patterns
 88 | 4. If requested with additional context (e.g., "update memory bank using information from @/Makefile"), focus special attention on that source
 89 | 
 90 | Note: When triggered by **update memory bank**, I MUST review every memory bank file, even if some don't require updates. Focus particularly on context.md as it tracks current state.
 91 | 
 92 | ### Add Task
 93 | 
 94 | When user completes a repetitive task (like adding support for a new model version) and wants to document it for future reference, they can request: **add task** or **store this as a task**.
 95 | 
 96 | This workflow is designed for repetitive tasks that follow similar patterns and require editing the same files. Examples include:
 97 | - Adding support for new AI model versions
 98 | - Implementing new API endpoints following established patterns
 99 | - Adding new features that follow existing architecture
100 | 
101 | Tasks are stored in the file `tasks.md` in the memory bank folder. The file is optional and can be empty. The file can store many tasks. 
102 | 
103 | To execute Add Task workflow:
104 | 
105 | 1. Create or update `tasks.md` in the memory bank folder
106 | 2. Document the task with:
107 |    - Task name and description
108 |    - Files that need to be modified
109 |    - Step-by-step workflow followed
110 |    - Important considerations or gotchas
111 |    - Example of the completed implementation
112 | 3. Include any context that was discovered during task execution but wasn't previously documented
113 | 
114 | Example task entry:
115 | ```markdown
116 | ## Add New Model Support
117 | **Last performed:** [date]
118 | **Files to modify:**
119 | - `/providers/gemini.md` - Add model to documentation
120 | - `/src/providers/gemini-config.ts` - Add model configuration
121 | - `/src/constants/models.ts` - Add to model list
122 | - `/tests/providers/gemini.test.ts` - Add test cases
123 | 
124 | **Steps:**
125 | 1. Add model configuration with proper token limits
126 | 2. Update documentation with model capabilities
127 | 3. Add to constants file for UI display
128 | 4. Write tests for new model configuration
129 | 
130 | **Important notes:**
131 | - Check Google's documentation for exact token limits
132 | - Ensure backward compatibility with existing configurations
133 | - Test with actual API calls before committing
134 | ```
135 | 
136 | ### Regular Task Execution
137 | 
138 | In the beginning of EVERY task I MUST read ALL memory bank files - this is not optional. 
139 | 
140 | The memory bank files are located in [`.kilocode/rules/memory-bank/`](.kilocode/rules/memory-bank) folder. If the folder doesn't exist or is empty, I will warn user about potential issues with the memory bank. I will include `[Memory Bank: Active]` at the beginning of my response if I successfully read the memory bank files, or `[Memory Bank: Missing]` if the folder doesn't exist or is empty. If memory bank is missing, I will warn the user about potential issues and suggest initialization. I should briefly summarize my understanding of the project to confirm alignment with the user's expectations, like:
141 | 
142 | "[Memory Bank: Active] I understand we're building a React inventory system with barcode scanning. Currently implementing the scanner component that needs to work with the backend API."
143 | 
144 | When starting a task that matches a documented task in `tasks.md`, I should mention this and follow the documented workflow to ensure no steps are missed.
145 | 
146 | If the task was repetitive and might be needed again, I should suggest: "Would you like me to add this task to the memory bank for future reference?"
147 | 
148 | In the end of the task, when it seems to be completed, I will update `context.md` accordingly. If the change seems significant, I will suggest to the user: "Would you like me to update memory bank to reflect these changes?" I will not suggest updates for minor changes.
149 | 
150 | ## Context Window Management
151 | 
152 | When the context window fills up during an extended session:
153 | 1. I should suggest updating the memory bank to preserve the current state
154 | 2. Recommend starting a fresh conversation/task
155 | 3. In the new conversation, I will automatically load the memory bank files to maintain continuity
156 | 
157 | ## Technical Implementation
158 | 
159 | Memory Bank is built on Kilo Code's Custom Rules feature, with files stored as standard markdown documents that both the user and I can access.
160 | 
161 | ## Important Notes
162 | 
163 | REMEMBER: After every memory reset, I begin completely fresh. The Memory Bank is my only link to previous work. It must be maintained with precision and clarity, as my effectiveness depends entirely on its accuracy.
164 | 
165 | If I detect inconsistencies between memory bank files, I should prioritize brief.md and note any discrepancies to the user.
166 | 
167 | IMPORTANT: I MUST read ALL memory bank files at the start of EVERY task - this is not optional. The memory bank files are located in [`.kilocode/rules/memory-bank/`](.kilocode/rules/memory-bank) folder.
168 | 
169 | //endregion Memory Bank
</content>

 43 |     # Required NVIDIA device files for GPU acceleration
 44 |     local required_devices=(
 45 |         "/dev/nvidia-uvm"
 46 |         "/dev/nvidia0"
 47 |         "/dev/nvidiactl"
 48 |     )
 49 |     
 50 |     local attempts=0
 51 |     local max_attempts=$((timeout / 2))  # Check every 2 seconds
 52 |     
 53 |     while [[ $attempts -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
 54 |         # Check all required devices
 55 |         local all_devices_available=true
 56 |         local missing_devices=()
 57 |         
 58 |         for device in "${required_devices[@]}"; do
 59 |             if [[ ! -e "$device" ]]; then
 60 |                 all_devices_available=false
 61 |                 missing_devices+=("$device")
 62 |             fi
 63 |         done
 64 |         
 65 |         # If all devices are available, we're good to go
 66 |         if [[ "$all_devices_available" == true ]]; then
 67 |             log_success "All NVIDIA GPU devices are available"
 68 |             log_info "Found devices: ${required_devices[*]}"
 69 |             return 0
 70 |         fi
 71 |         
 72 |         # Log missing devices (but only every 5 attempts to avoid spam)
 73 |         if [[ $((attempts % 5)) -eq 0 ]] && [[ $attempts -gt 0 ]]; then
 74 |             local elapsed=$((attempts * 2))
 75 |             log_info "Waiting for NVIDIA devices (${elapsed}s/${timeout}s) - Missing: ${missing_devices[*]}"
 76 |         fi
 77 |         
 78 |         # Wait before next check
 79 |         sleep 2
 80 |         attempts=$((attempts + 1))
 81 |     done
 82 |     
 83 |     # Timeout reached
 84 |     log_warning "GPU availability check timeout after ${timeout}s"
 85 |     log_warning "NVIDIA devices not available - proceeding without GPU acceleration"
 86 |     return 1
 87 | }
 88 | 
 89 | # Create temporary compose file without GPU acceleration
 90 | create_gpu_fallback_compose() {
 91 |     local original_compose="$1"
 92 |     local fallback_compose="$2"
 93 |     
 94 |     log_info "Creating GPU fallback configuration..."
 95 |     
 96 |     # Copy original compose file and remove GPU-specific configurations
 97 |     cp "$original_compose" "$fallback_compose"
 98 |     
 99 |     # Remove nvidia.com/gpu device mapping and NVIDIA environment variables
100 |     sed -i '/nvidia\.com\/gpu=all/d' "$fallback_compose"
101 |     sed -i '/NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES/d' "$fallback_compose"
102 |     sed -i '/NVIDIA_DRIVER_CAPABILITIES/d' "$fallback_compose"
103 |     
104 |     log_info "GPU fallback compose file created: $fallback_compose"
105 |     log_warning "Jellyfin will start without GPU acceleration"
106 | }
107 | 
108 | # Check if podman-compose is available
109 | check_podman_compose() {
110 |     if command -v podman-compose >/dev/null 2>&1; then
111 |         COMPOSE_CMD="podman-compose"
112 |     elif command -v docker-compose >/dev/null 2>&1 && command -v podman >/dev/null 2>&1; then
113 |         COMPOSE_CMD="docker-compose"
114 |         log_warning "Using docker-compose with podman backend"
115 |     else
116 |         log_error "Neither podman-compose nor docker-compose found!"
117 |         log_error "Install podman-compose: pip install podman-compose"
118 |         exit 1
119 |     fi
120 | }
121 | 
122 | # Check if environment file exists
123 | check_env_file() {
124 |     if [[ ! -f "$ENV_FILE" ]]; then
125 |         log_warning "Environment file $ENV_FILE not found!"
126 |         if [[ -f "core/.env.example" ]]; then
127 |             log_info "Creating $ENV_FILE from core/.env.example"
128 |             cp core/.env.example "$ENV_FILE"
129 |             log_warning "Please edit $ENV_FILE with your settings before running again!"
130 |             exit 1
131 |         else
132 |             log_error "No .env.example file found. Please create $ENV_FILE manually."
133 |             exit 1
134 |         fi
135 |     fi
136 | }
137 | 
138 | # Check Podman setup
139 | check_podman_setup() {
140 |     if ! command -v podman >/dev/null 2>&1; then
141 |         log_error "Podman not found! Please install Podman first."
142 |         exit 1
143 |     fi
144 | 
145 |     # Check if rootless or rootful
146 |     if [[ $EUID -eq 0 ]]; then
147 |         log_info "Running as root (rootful Podman)"
148 |         PODMAN_MODE="rootful"
149 |     else
150 |         log_info "Running as user (rootless Podman)"
151 |         PODMAN_MODE="rootless"
152 |         
153 |         # Check if user can create containers
154 |         if ! podman info >/dev/null 2>&1; then
155 |             log_warning "Podman not properly configured for rootless operation"
156 |             log_info "Run: podman system migrate"
157 |         fi
158 |     fi
159 | }
160 | 
161 | # Main execution
162 | main() {
163 |     log_info "Starting Podman Media Stack..."
164 |     
165 |     # Pre-flight checks
166 |     check_podman_setup
167 |     check_podman_compose
168 |     check_env_file
169 |     
170 |     # Check if compose file exists
171 |     if [[ ! -f "$COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
172 |         log_error "Compose file $COMPOSE_FILE not found!"
173 |         exit 1
174 |     fi
175 |     
176 |     # Parse command line arguments
177 |     SERVICES=""
178 |     BUILD_FLAG=""
179 |     FORCE_RECREATE=""
180 |     SKIP_GPU_CHECK=""
181 |     
182 |     while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
183 |         case $1 in
184 |             --build)
185 |                 BUILD_FLAG="--build"
186 |                 shift
187 |                 ;;
188 |             --force-recreate)
189 |                 FORCE_RECREATE="--force-recreate"
190 |                 shift
191 |                 ;;
192 |             --skip-gpu-check)
193 |                 SKIP_GPU_CHECK="true"
194 |                 shift
195 |                 ;;
196 |             --help|-h)
197 |                 echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS] [SERVICES...]"
198 |                 echo ""
199 |                 echo "Options:"
200 |                 echo "  --build           Build images before starting"
201 |                 echo "  --force-recreate  Recreate containers even if config unchanged"
202 |                 echo "  --skip-gpu-check  Skip NVIDIA GPU availability check"
203 |                 echo "  --help, -h        Show this help message"
204 |                 echo ""
205 |                 echo "Services:"
206 |                 echo "  If no services specified, all services will be started"
207 |                 echo "  Available services: pia-wggen, flaresolverr, prowlarr, sonarr,"
208 |                 echo "                     radarr, bazarr, gluetun, pia-pf, qbittorrent, jellyfin"
209 |                 exit 0
210 |                 ;;
211 |             -*)
212 |                 log_error "Unknown option: $1"
213 |                 exit 1
214 |                 ;;
215 |             *)
216 |                 SERVICES="$SERVICES $1"
217 |                 shift
218 |                 ;;
219 |         esac
220 |     done
221 |     
222 |     # GPU availability check and compose file selection
223 |     local ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE="$COMPOSE_FILE"
224 |     local FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE=""
225 |     local GPU_AVAILABLE=false
226 |     
227 |     # Check if we should skip GPU check or if Jellyfin is specifically requested
228 |     if [[ "$SKIP_GPU_CHECK" != "true" ]] && [[ -z "$SERVICES" || "$SERVICES" =~ jellyfin ]]; then
229 |         log_info "Checking NVIDIA GPU availability for Jellyfin..."
230 |         
231 |         if check_nvidia_gpu_availability 60; then
232 |             log_success "NVIDIA GPU devices available - using full GPU acceleration"
233 |             GPU_AVAILABLE=true
234 |         else
235 |             log_warning "NVIDIA GPU devices not available - creating fallback configuration"
236 |             
237 |             # Create fallback compose file without GPU acceleration
238 |             FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE="$(dirname "$COMPOSE_FILE")/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml"
239 |             create_gpu_fallback_compose "$COMPOSE_FILE" "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE"
240 |             ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE="$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE"
241 |             GPU_AVAILABLE=false
242 |         fi
243 |     else
244 |         if [[ "$SKIP_GPU_CHECK" == "true" ]]; then
245 |             log_info "GPU check skipped - using original configuration"
246 |         else
247 |             log_info "Jellyfin not in service list - skipping GPU check"
248 |         fi
249 |         GPU_AVAILABLE=true  # Assume available when skipping check
250 |     fi
251 |     
252 |     # Build the command with the selected compose file
253 |     CMD="$COMPOSE_CMD --env-file $ENV_FILE -f $ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE up -d $BUILD_FLAG $FORCE_RECREATE $SERVICES"
254 |     
255 |     log_info "Executing: $CMD"
256 |     
257 |     # Execute the command
258 |     local SUCCESS=false
259 |     if $CMD; then
260 |         SUCCESS=true
261 |         log_success "Media stack started successfully!"
262 |         
263 |         # Display GPU status in success message
264 |         if [[ "$GPU_AVAILABLE" == true ]]; then
265 |             log_success "Jellyfin started with NVIDIA GPU acceleration enabled"
266 |         elif [[ -n "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
267 |             log_warning "Jellyfin started without GPU acceleration (GPU devices not available)"
268 |             log_info "GPU acceleration will be available after next restart once NVIDIA drivers are loaded"
269 |         fi
270 |         
271 |         echo ""
272 |         log_info "Service status:"
273 |         $COMPOSE_CMD --env-file $ENV_FILE -f $ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE ps
274 |         echo ""
275 |         log_info "Useful commands:"
276 |         echo "  View logs: ./scripts/podman-logs.sh"
277 |         echo "  Stop stack: ./scripts/podman-down.sh"
278 |         echo "  Check status: $COMPOSE_CMD --env-file $ENV_FILE -f $ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE ps"
279 |         echo ""
280 |         log_info "Web interfaces:"
281 |         echo "  Prowlarr:    http://localhost:9696"
282 |         echo "  Sonarr:      http://localhost:8989"
283 |         echo "  Radarr:      http://localhost:7878"
284 |         echo "  Bazarr:      http://localhost:6767"
285 |         echo "  qBittorrent: http://localhost:8080"
286 |         echo "  Jellyfin:    http://localhost:8096"
287 |         echo "  FlareSolverr: http://localhost:8191"
288 |     else
289 |         log_error "Failed to start media stack!"
290 |     fi
291 |     
292 |     # Cleanup fallback compose file if it was created
293 |     if [[ -n "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE" ]] && [[ -f "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
294 |         log_info "Cleaning up temporary GPU fallback configuration"
295 |         rm -f "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE"
296 |     fi
297 |     
298 |     # Exit with appropriate code
299 |     if [[ "$SUCCESS" == true ]]; then
300 |         exit 0
301 |     else
302 |         exit 1
303 |     fi
304 | }
305 | 
306 | # Run main function
307 | main "$@"
</content>
</file>

<content lines="1-177">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # Podman Media Stack Shutdown Script
  3 | # ===================================
  4 | # Stops the media stack using Podman with proper cleanup options.
  5 | 
  6 | set -e  # Exit on any error
  7 | 
  8 | # Configuration
  9 | COMPOSE_FILE="core/podman-compose.yml"
 10 | 
 11 | # Colors for output
 12 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 13 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 14 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 15 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 16 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 17 | 
 18 | # Functions
 19 | log_info() {
 20 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
 21 | }
 22 | 
 23 | log_success() {
 24 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
 25 | }
 26 | 
 27 | log_warning() {
 28 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
 29 | }
 30 | 
 31 | log_error() {
 32 |     echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
 33 | }
 34 | 
 35 | # Check if podman-compose is available
 36 | check_podman_compose() {
 37 |     if command -v podman-compose >/dev/null 2>&1; then
 38 |         COMPOSE_CMD="podman-compose"
 39 |     elif command -v docker-compose >/dev/null 2>&1 && command -v podman >/dev/null 2>&1; then
 40 |         COMPOSE_CMD="docker-compose"
 41 |         log_warning "Using docker-compose with podman backend"
 42 |     else
 43 |         log_error "Neither podman-compose nor docker-compose found!"
 44 |         exit 1
 45 |     fi
 46 | }
 47 | 
 48 | # Main execution
 49 | main() {
 50 |     log_info "Stopping Podman Media Stack..."
 51 |     
 52 |     # Pre-flight checks
 53 |     check_podman_compose
 54 |     
 55 |     # Check if compose file exists
 56 |     if [[ ! -f "$COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
 57 |         log_error "Compose file $COMPOSE_FILE not found!"
 58 |         exit 1
 59 |     fi
 60 |     
 61 |     # Parse command line arguments
 62 |     SERVICES=""
 63 |     REMOVE_VOLUMES=""
 64 |     REMOVE_IMAGES=""
 65 |     TIMEOUT=""
 66 |     
 67 |     while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
 68 |         case $1 in
 69 |             --volumes|-v)
 70 |                 REMOVE_VOLUMES="--volumes"
 71 |                 shift
 72 |                 ;;
 73 |             --rmi)
 74 |                 if [[ -n "$2" && "$2" =~ ^(all|local)$ ]]; then
 75 |                     REMOVE_IMAGES="--rmi $2"
 76 |                     shift 2
 77 |                 else
 78 |                     REMOVE_IMAGES="--rmi local"
 79 |                     shift
 80 |                 fi
 81 |                 ;;
 82 |             --timeout|-t)
 83 |                 if [[ -n "$2" && "$2" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
 84 |                     TIMEOUT="--timeout $2"
 85 |                     shift 2
 86 |                 else
 87 |                     log_error "Invalid timeout value: $2"
 88 |                     exit 1
 89 |                 fi
 90 |                 ;;
 91 |             --help|-h)
 92 |                 echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS] [SERVICES...]"
 93 |                 echo ""
 94 |                 echo "Options:"
 95 |                 echo "  --volumes, -v        Remove named volumes declared in volumes section"
 96 |                 echo "  --rmi [all|local]    Remove images (all: all images, local: only local images)"
 97 |                 echo "  --timeout, -t TIME   Specify timeout for container stop (default: 10)"
 98 |                 echo "  --help, -h           Show this help message"
 99 |                 echo ""
100 |                 echo "Services:"
101 |                 echo "  If no services specified, all services will be stopped"
102 |                 echo "  Available services: pia-wggen, flaresolverr, prowlarr, sonarr,"
103 |                 echo "                     radarr, bazarr, gluetun, pia-pf, qbittorrent, jellyfin"
104 |                 echo ""
105 |                 echo "Examples:"
106 |                 echo "  $0                    # Stop all services"
107 |                 echo "  $0 jellyfin qbittorrent  # Stop specific services"
108 |                 echo "  $0 --volumes          # Stop all and remove volumes"
109 |                 echo "  $0 --rmi local        # Stop all and remove local images"
110 |                 exit 0
111 |                 ;;
112 |             -*)
113 |                 log_error "Unknown option: $1"
114 |                 exit 1
115 |                 ;;
116 |             *)
117 |                 SERVICES="$SERVICES $1"
118 |                 shift
119 |                 ;;
120 |         esac
121 |     done
122 |     
123 |     # Show current status before stopping
124 |     log_info "Current service status:"
125 |     $COMPOSE_CMD -f $COMPOSE_FILE ps 2>/dev/null || log_warning "No services currently running"
126 |     echo ""
127 |     
128 |     # Build the command
129 |     CMD="$COMPOSE_CMD -f $COMPOSE_FILE down $TIMEOUT $REMOVE_VOLUMES $REMOVE_IMAGES"
130 |     
131 |     # If specific services are mentioned, stop them individually
132 |     if [[ -n "$SERVICES" ]]; then
133 |         log_info "Stopping specific services:$SERVICES"
134 |         if $COMPOSE_CMD -f $COMPOSE_FILE stop $TIMEOUT $SERVICES; then
135 |             log_success "Services stopped successfully!"
136 |         else
137 |             log_error "Failed to stop some services!"
138 |             exit 1
139 |         fi
140 |     else
141 |         log_info "Executing: $CMD"
142 |         
143 |         # Execute the command
144 |         if $CMD; then
145 |             log_success "Media stack stopped successfully!"
146 |             
147 |             # Additional cleanup information
148 |             if [[ -n "$REMOVE_VOLUMES" ]]; then
149 |                 log_info "Named volumes have been removed"
150 |             fi
151 |             
152 |             if [[ -n "$REMOVE_IMAGES" ]]; then
153 |                 log_info "Images have been removed"
154 |             fi
155 |             
156 |             # Show final status
157 |             echo ""
158 |             log_info "Final service status:"
159 |             $COMPOSE_CMD -f $COMPOSE_FILE ps -a 2>/dev/null || echo "No containers found"
160 |             
161 |         else
162 |             log_error "Failed to stop media stack!"
163 |             exit 1
164 |         fi
165 |     fi
166 |     
167 |     echo ""
168 |     log_info "Useful commands:"
169 |     echo "  Start stack: ./start.sh"
170 |     echo "  Check logs: ./logs.sh"
171 |     echo "  Clean up containers: podman container prune"
172 |     echo "  Clean up images: podman image prune"
173 |     echo "  Clean up volumes: podman volume prune"
174 | }
175 | 
176 | # Run main function
177 | main "$@"
</content>

<content lines="1-642">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | set -euo pipefail
  3 | 
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | #                         MEDIA STACK MAINTENANCE SCRIPT
  6 | # =============================================================================
  7 | # Comprehensive maintenance, debugging, and health check tool for media-stack
  8 | # Provides automated troubleshooting, system monitoring, and cleanup utilities
  9 | #
 10 | # Usage: ./maintenance.sh [COMMAND] [OPTIONS]
 11 | # Commands: health, logs, diagnostic, cleanup, debug-enable, debug-disable
 12 | # =============================================================================
 13 | 
 14 | # Script configuration - Determine if called from root or from maintenance directory
 15 | if [[ "$(basename "$(pwd)")" == "maintenance" ]]; then
 16 |     # Called directly from maintenance directory
 17 |     PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd .. && pwd)"
 18 | else
 19 |     # Called via wrapper from root directory
 20 |     PROJECT_ROOT="$(pwd)"
 21 | fi
 22 | 
 23 | LOG_DIR="${PROJECT_ROOT}/logs"
 24 | TEMP_DIR="${PROJECT_ROOT}/tmp"
 25 | COMPOSE_FILE="${PROJECT_ROOT}/core/podman-compose.yml"
 26 | ENV_FILE="${PROJECT_ROOT}/.env"
 27 | DEBUG_LOG_FILE="${LOG_DIR}/maintenance-debug.log"
 28 | 
 29 | # Color codes for output
 30 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 31 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 32 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 33 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 34 | PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
 35 | CYAN='\033[0;36m'
 36 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 37 | 
 38 | # Logging functions
 39 | log_info() {
 40 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 41 | }
 42 | 
 43 | log_warn() {
 44 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 45 | }
 46 | 
 47 | log_error() {
 48 |     echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | log_debug() {
 52 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[DEBUG]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 53 | }
 54 | 
 55 | log_section() {
 56 |     echo -e "\n${PURPLE}=== $1 ===${NC}" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 57 | }
 58 | 
 59 | # Initialize log directory
 60 | mkdir -p "${LOG_DIR}" "${TEMP_DIR}"
 61 | 
 62 | # =============================================================================
 63 | #                            HEALTH CHECK FUNCTIONS
 64 | # =============================================================================
 65 | 
 66 | check_podman_compose() {
 67 |     log_debug "Checking podman-compose availability..."
 68 |     if ! command -v podman-compose &> /dev/null; then
 69 |         log_error "podman-compose not found. Please install Podman Compose."
 70 |         return 1
 71 |     fi
 72 |     log_info "Podman Compose: $(podman-compose --version)"
 73 |     return 0
 74 | }
 75 | 
 76 | check_environment_file() {
 77 |     log_debug "Checking environment configuration..."
 78 |     if [[ ! -f "$ENV_FILE" ]]; then
 79 |         log_error "Environment file not found: $ENV_FILE"
 80 |         log_info "Create it from .env.example: cp core/.env.example .env"
 81 |         return 1
 82 |     fi
 83 |     
 84 |     # Check for required variables
 85 |     local required_vars=("PIA_USER" "PIA_PASS" "QBIT_USER" "QBIT_PASS")
 86 |     local missing_vars=()
 87 |     
 88 |     for var in "${required_vars[@]}"; do
 89 |         if ! grep -q "^${var}=" "$ENV_FILE" || grep -q "^${var}=$" "$ENV_FILE"; then
 90 |             missing_vars+=("$var")
 91 |         fi
 92 |     done
 93 |     
 94 |     if [[ ${#missing_vars[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
 95 |         log_error "Missing required environment variables: ${missing_vars[*]}"
 96 |         return 1
 97 |     fi
 98 |     
 99 |     log_info "Environment configuration: ✓"
100 |     return 0
101 | }
102 | 
103 | check_services_status() {
104 |     log_debug "Checking Podman services status..."
105 |     local services_output
106 |     services_output=$(podman-compose ps --format table 2>/dev/null || true)
107 |     
108 |     if [[ -z "$services_output" ]]; then
109 |         log_warn "No services found or podman-compose not running"
110 |         return 1
111 |     fi
112 |     
113 |     echo "$services_output"
114 |     
115 |     # Check if any services are unhealthy
116 |     local unhealthy_services
117 |     unhealthy_services=$(podman-compose ps --filter status=unhealthy --format "{{.Service}}" 2>/dev/null || true)
118 |     
119 |     if [[ -n "$unhealthy_services" ]]; then
120 |         log_warn "Unhealthy services detected: $unhealthy_services"
121 |         return 1
122 |     fi
123 |     
124 |     log_info "All services appear healthy"
125 |     return 0
126 | }
127 | 
128 | check_vpn_connectivity() {
129 |     log_debug "Testing VPN connectivity..."
130 |     local vpn_ip
131 |     vpn_ip=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io/ip 2>/dev/null || echo "failed")
132 |     
133 |     if [[ "$vpn_ip" == "failed" ]]; then
134 |         log_error "VPN connectivity test failed"
135 |         return 1
136 |     fi
137 |     
138 |     log_info "VPN IP: $vpn_ip"
139 |     
140 |     # Check if IP is different from host IP
141 |     local host_ip
142 |     host_ip=$(wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io/ip 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
143 |     
144 |     if [[ "$vpn_ip" == "$host_ip" ]]; then
145 |         log_warn "VPN IP matches host IP - VPN may not be working correctly"
146 |         return 1
147 |     fi
148 |     
149 |     log_info "VPN connectivity: ✓"
150 |     return 0
151 | }
152 | 
153 | check_port_forwarding() {
154 |     log_debug "Checking port forwarding status..."
155 |     local forwarded_port_file="/tmp/gluetun/forwarded_port"
156 |     
157 |     # Try to get forwarded port from container
158 |     local forwarded_port
159 |     forwarded_port=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun cat "$forwarded_port_file" 2>/dev/null | tr -d '\r\n' || echo "")
160 |     
161 |     if [[ -z "$forwarded_port" ]] || [[ ! "$forwarded_port" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
162 |         log_warn "No valid forwarded port found"
163 |         return 1
164 |     fi
165 |     
166 |     log_info "Forwarded port: $forwarded_port"
167 |     
168 |     # Test port accessibility
169 |     log_debug "Testing port accessibility..."
170 |     local port_test_result
171 |     port_test_result=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun timeout 10 nc -z portchecker.co 80 2>/dev/null && echo "success" || echo "failed")
172 |     
173 |     if [[ "$port_test_result" == "failed" ]]; then
174 |         log_warn "Port connectivity test failed"
175 |         return 1
176 |     fi
177 |     
178 |     log_info "Port forwarding: ✓"
179 |     return 0
180 | }
181 | 
182 | check_qbittorrent_connectivity() {
183 |     log_debug "Testing qBittorrent connectivity..."
184 |     local qb_response
185 |     qb_response=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun wget -qO- --timeout=5 http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/v2/app/version 2>/dev/null || echo "failed")
186 |     
187 |     if [[ "$qb_response" == "failed" ]]; then
188 |         log_error "qBittorrent not accessible"
189 |         return 1
190 |     fi
191 |     
192 |     log_info "qBittorrent version: $qb_response"
193 |     return 0
194 | }
195 | 
196 | check_service_connectivity() {
197 |     log_debug "Testing inter-service connectivity..."
198 |     local services=("prowlarr:9696" "sonarr:8989" "radarr:7878" "bazarr:6767" "jellyfin:8096")
199 |     local failed_services=()
200 |

 56 |         local missing_devices=()

  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | set -euo pipefail
  3 | 
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | #                         MEDIA STACK MAINTENANCE SCRIPT
  6 | # =============================================================================
  7 | # Comprehensive maintenance, debugging, and health check tool for media-stack
  8 | # Provides automated troubleshooting, system monitoring, and cleanup utilities
  9 | #
 10 | # Usage: ./maintenance.sh [COMMAND] [OPTIONS]
 11 | # Commands: health, logs, diagnostic, cleanup, debug-enable, debug-disable
 12 | # =============================================================================
 13 | 
 14 | # Script configuration - Determine if called from root or from maintenance directory
 15 | if [[ "$(basename "$(pwd)")" == "maintenance" ]]; then
 16 |     # Called directly from maintenance directory
 17 |     PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd .. && pwd)"
 18 | else
 19 |     # Called via wrapper from root directory
 20 |     PROJECT_ROOT="$(pwd)"
 21 | fi
 22 | 
 23 | LOG_DIR="${PROJECT_ROOT}/logs"
 24 | TEMP_DIR="${PROJECT_ROOT}/tmp"
 25 | COMPOSE_FILE="${PROJECT_ROOT}/core/podman-compose.yml"
 26 | ENV_FILE="${PROJECT_ROOT}/core/.env"
 27 | DEBUG_LOG_FILE="${LOG_DIR}/maintenance-debug.log"
 28 | 
 29 | # Color codes for output
 30 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 31 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 32 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 33 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 34 | PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
 35 | CYAN='\033[0;36m'
 36 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 37 | 
 38 | # Logging functions
 39 | log_info() {
 40 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 41 | }
 42 | 
 43 | log_warn() {
 44 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 45 | }
 46 | 
 47 | log_error() {
 48 |     echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | log_debug() {
 52 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[DEBUG]${NC} $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') $1" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 53 | }
 54 | 
 55 | log_section() {
 56 |     echo -e "\n${PURPLE}=== $1 ===${NC}" | tee -a "${DEBUG_LOG_FILE}"
 57 | }
 58 | 
 59 | # Initialize log directory
 60 | mkdir -p "${LOG_DIR}" "${TEMP_DIR}"
 61 | 
 62 | # =============================================================================
 63 | #                            HEALTH CHECK FUNCTIONS
 64 | # =============================================================================
 65 | 
 66 | check_podman_compose() {
 67 |     log_debug "Checking podman-compose availability..."
 68 |     if ! command -v podman-compose &> /dev/null; then
 69 |         log_error "podman-compose not found. Please install Podman Compose."
 70 |         return 1
 71 |     fi
 72 |     log_info "Podman Compose: $(podman-compose --version)"
 73 |     return 0
 74 | }
 75 | 
 76 | check_environment_file() {
 77 |     log_debug "Checking environment configuration..."
 78 |     if [[ ! -f "$ENV_FILE" ]]; then
 79 |         log_error "Environment file not found: $ENV_FILE"
 80 |         log_info "Create it from core/.env.example: cp core/.env.example core/.env"
 81 |         return 1
 82 |     fi
 83 |     
 84 |     # Check for required variables
 85 |     local required_vars=("PIA_USER" "PIA_PASS" "QBIT_USER" "QBIT_PASS")
 86 |     local missing_vars=()
 87 |     
 88 |     for var in "${required_vars[@]}"; do
 89 |         if ! grep -q "^${var}=" "$ENV_FILE" || grep -q "^${var}=$" "$ENV_FILE"; then
 90 |             missing_vars+=("$var")
 91 |         fi
 92 |     done
 93 |     
 94 |     if [[ ${#missing_vars[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
 95 |         log_error "Missing required environment variables: ${missing_vars[*]}"
 96 |         return 1
 97 |     fi
 98 |     
 99 |     log_info "Environment configuration: ✓"
100 |     return 0
101 | }
102 | 
103 | check_services_status() {
104 |     log_debug "Checking Podman services status..."
105 |     local services_output
106 |     services_output=$(podman-compose ps --format table 2>/dev/null || true)
107 |     
108 |     if [[ -z "$services_output" ]]; then
109 |         log_warn "No services found or podman-compose not running"
110 |         return 1
111 |     fi
112 |     
113 |     echo "$services_output"
114 |     
115 |     # Check if any services are unhealthy
116 |     local unhealthy_services
117 |     unhealthy_services=$(podman-compose ps --filter status=unhealthy --format "{{.Service}}" 2>/dev/null || true)
118 |     
119 |     if [[ -n "$unhealthy_services" ]]; then
120 |         log_warn "Unhealthy services detected: $unhealthy_services"
121 |         return 1
122 |     fi
123 |     
124 |     log_info "All services appear healthy"
125 |     return 0
126 | }
127 | 
128 | check_vpn_connectivity() {
129 |     log_debug "Testing VPN connectivity..."
130 |     local vpn_ip
131 |     vpn_ip=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io/ip 2>/dev/null || echo "failed")
132 |     
133 |     if [[ "$vpn_ip" == "failed" ]]; then
134 |         log_error "VPN connectivity test failed"
135 |         return 1
136 |     fi
137 |     
138 |     log_info "VPN IP: $vpn_ip"
139 |     
140 |     # Check if IP is different from host IP
141 |     local host_ip
142 |     host_ip=$(wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io/ip 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
143 |     
144 |     if [[ "$vpn_ip" == "$host_ip" ]]; then
145 |         log_warn "VPN IP matches host IP - VPN may not be working correctly"
146 |         return 1
147 |     fi
148 |     
149 |     log_info "VPN connectivity: ✓"
150 |     return 0
151 | }

153 | check_port_forwarding() {
154 |     log_debug "Checking port forwarding status..."
155 |     local forwarded_port_file="/tmp/gluetun/forwarded_port"
156 |     
157 |     # Try to get forwarded port from container
158 |     local forwarded_port
159 |     forwarded_port=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun cat "$forwarded_port_file" 2>/dev/null | tr -d '\r\n' || echo "")
160 |     
161 |     if [[ -z "$forwarded_port" ]] || [[ ! "$forwarded_port" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
162 |         log_warn "No valid forwarded port found"
163 |         return 1
164 |     fi
165 |     
166 |     log_info "Forwarded port: $forwarded_port"
167 |     
168 |     # Test port accessibility
169 |     log_debug "Testing port accessibility..."
170 |     local port_test_result
171 |     port_test_result=$(podman-compose exec -T gluetun timeout 10 nc -z portchecker.co 80 2>/dev/null && echo "success" || echo "failed")
172 |     
173 |     if [[ "$port_test_result" == "failed" ]]; then
174 |         log_warn "Port connectivity test failed"
175 |         return 1
176 |     fi
177 |     
178 |     log_info "Port forwarding: ✓"
179 |     return 0
180 | }

182 | check_qbittorrent_connectivity() {
183 |     log_debug "Testing qBittorrent connectivity..."

186 |     
187 |     if [[ "$qb_response" == "failed" ]]; then
188 |         log_error "qBittorrent not accessible"
189 |         return 1
190 |     fi
191 |     
192 |     log_info "qBittorrent version: $qb_response"
193 |     return 0
194 | }

196 | check_service_connectivity() {

198 |     local services=("prowlarr:9696" "sonarr:8989" "radarr:7878" "bazarr:6767" "jellyfin:8096")
199 |     local failed_services=()
200 |     
201 |     for service in "${services[@]}"; do
202 |         local service_name="${service%:*}"
203 |         local service_port="${service#*:}"
204 |         
205 |         if ! podman-compose exec -T "$service_name" timeout 5 curl -s "http://localhost:$service_port" &>/dev/null; then
206 |             failed_services+=("$service_name")
207 |         fi
208 |     done
209 |     
210 |     if [[ ${#failed_services[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
211 |         log_warn "Services not responding: ${failed_services[*]}"
212 |         return 1
213 |     fi
214 |     
215 |     log_info "Service connectivity: ✓"
216 |     return 0
217 | }

  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # Podman Media Stack Shutdown Script
  3 | # ===================================
  4 | # Stops the media stack using Podman with proper cleanup options.
  5 | 
  6 | set -e  # Exit on any error
  7 | 
  8 | # Configuration
  9 | COMPOSE_FILE="core/podman-compose.yml"
 10 | 
 11 | # Colors for output
 12 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 13 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 14 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 15 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 16 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 17 | 
 18 | # Functions
 19 | log_info() {
 20 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
 21 | }
 22 | 
 23 | log_success() {
 24 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
 25 | }
 26 | 
 27 | log_warning() {
 28 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
 29 | }
 30 | 
 31 | log_error() {
 32 |     echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
 33 | }
 34 | 
 35 | # Check if podman-compose is available
 36 | check_podman_compose() {
 37 |     if command -v podman-compose >/dev/null 2>&1; then
 38 |         COMPOSE_CMD="podman-compose"
 39 |     elif command -v docker-compose >/dev/null 2>&1 && command -v podman >/dev/null 2>&1; then
 40 |         COMPOSE_CMD="docker-compose"
 41 |         log_warning "Using docker-compose with podman backend"
 42 |     else
 43 |         log_error "Neither podman-compose nor docker-compose found!"
 44 |         exit 1
 45 |     fi
 46 | }
 47 | 
 48 | # Main execution
 49 | main() {
 50 |     log_info "Stopping Podman Media Stack..."
 51 |     
 52 |     # Pre-flight checks
 53 |     check_podman_compose
 54 |     
 55 |     # Check if compose file exists
 56 |     if [[ ! -f "$COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
 57 |         log_error "Compose file $COMPOSE_FILE not found!"
 58 |         exit 1
 59 |     fi
 60 |     
 61 |     # Parse command line arguments
 62 |     SERVICES=""
 63 |     REMOVE_VOLUMES=""
 64 |     REMOVE_IMAGES=""
 65 |     TIMEOUT=""
 66 |     
 67 |     while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
 68 |         case $1 in
 69 |             --volumes|-v)
 70 |                 REMOVE_VOLUMES="--volumes"
 71 |                 shift
 72 |                 ;;
 73 |             --rmi)
 74 |                 if [[ -n "$2" && "$2" =~ ^(all|local)$ ]]; then
 75 |                     REMOVE_IMAGES="--rmi $2"
 76 |                     shift 2
 77 |                 else
 78 |                     REMOVE_IMAGES="--rmi local"
 79 |                     shift
 80 |                 fi
 81 |                 ;;
 82 |             --timeout|-t)
 83 |                 if [[ -n "$2" && "$2" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
 84 |                     TIMEOUT="--timeout $2"
 85 |                     shift 2
 86 |                 else
 87 |                     log_error "Invalid timeout value: $2"
 88 |                     exit 1
 89 |                 fi
 90 |                 ;;
 91 |             --help|-h)
 92 |                 echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS] [SERVICES...]"
 93 |                 echo ""
 94 |                 echo "Options:"
 95 |                 echo "  --volumes, -v        Remove named volumes declared in volumes section"
 96 |                 echo "  --rmi [all|local]    Remove images (all: all images, local: only local images)"
 97 |                 echo "  --timeout, -t TIME   Specify timeout for container stop (default: 10)"
 98 |                 echo "  --help, -h           Show this help message"
 99 |                 echo ""
100 |                 echo "Services:"
101 |                 echo "  If no services specified, all services will be stopped"
102 |                 echo "  Available services: pia-wggen, flaresolverr, prowlarr, sonarr,"
103 |                 echo "                     radarr, bazarr, gluetun, pia-pf, qbittorrent, jellyfin"
104 |                 echo ""
105 |                 echo "Examples:"
106 |                 echo "  $0                    # Stop all services"
107 |                 echo "  $0 jellyfin qbittorrent  # Stop specific services"
108 |                 echo "  $0 --volumes          # Stop all and remove volumes"
109 |                 echo "  $0 --rmi local        # Stop all and remove local images"
110 |                 exit 0
111 |                 ;;
112 |             -*)
113 |                 log_error "Unknown option: $1"
114 |                 exit 1
115 |                 ;;
116 |             *)
117 |                 SERVICES="$SERVICES $1"
118 |                 shift
119 |                 ;;
120 |         esac
121 |     done
122 |     
123 |     # Show current status before stopping
124 |     log_info "Current service status:"
125 |     $COMPOSE_CMD -f $COMPOSE_FILE ps 2>/dev/null || log_warning "No services currently running"
126 |     echo ""
127 |     
128 |     # Build the command

Summary of logic added for Jellyfin GPU fallback
- Maintains device-based GPU detection path. When GPU is available and Jellyfin is started:
  - After initial up, the script performs a post-start inspection with:
    - podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}}|{{.State.Error}}|{{.State.ExitCode}}'
  - Triggers GPU-failure fallback if any of:
    - Inspect fails
    - .State.Status != "running"
    - .State.ExitCode != 0
    - .State.Error non-empty OR matches libEGL/cannot stat /usr/lib64/libEGL patterns
- On GPU failure:
  - Logs a WARN with hint to [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1)
  - Runs: podman-compose --env-file core/.env -f core/podman-compose.yml down
  - Then: podman-compose --env-file core/.env -f core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml up -d
  - Re-inspects Jellyfin and logs running status summary
- All compose up/down invocations include --env-file core/.env
- set -e guarded with set +e around checks and down fallback to avoid premature exit

  [bash.main()](scripts/podman-up.sh:232)

  else
      log_warning "NVIDIA GPU devices not available - using no-GPU compose"
      
      # Use provided no-GPU compose variant without modifying repository files
      FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE="$(dirname "$COMPOSE_FILE")/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml"
      if [[ -f "$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE" ]]; then
          ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE="$FALLBACK_COMPOSE_FILE"

  ```
- Post-start Jellyfin verification and automatic fallback:
  [bash.main()](scripts/podman-up.sh:268)
  ```
  # Post-start verification for Jellyfin when GPU mode was selected
  if [[ "$GPU_AVAILABLE" == true ]] && [[ -z "$SERVICES" || "$SERVICES" =~ jellyfin ]]; then
      log_info "Verifying Jellyfin after GPU start..."
      sleep 8
      set +e
      JF_INSPECT="$(podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}}|{{.State.Error}}|{{.State.ExitCode}}' 2>/dev/null)"
      INSPECT_RC=$?
      set -e
      JF_STATUS="$(echo "$JF_INSPECT" | cut -d'|' -f1)"
      JF_ERROR="$(echo "$JF_INSPECT" | cut -d'|' -f2)"
      JF_EXITCODE="$(echo "$JF_INSPECT" | cut -d'|' -f3)"
      
      JF_FAIL=false
      if [[ $INSPECT_RC -ne 0 ]]; then JF_FAIL=true; fi
      if [[ "$JF_STATUS" != "running" ]]; then JF_FAIL=true; fi
      if [[ -n "$JF_EXITCODE" && "$JF_EXITCODE" != "0" ]]; then JF_FAIL=true; fi
      if [[ -n "$JF_ERROR" ]]; then JF_FAIL=true; fi
      if echo "$JF_ERROR" | grep -qiE 'libEGL|cannot stat .*libEGL'; then JF_FAIL=true; fi
      
      if [[ "$JF_FAIL" == true ]]; then
          log_warning "Jellyfin GPU start failure detected (status='$JF_STATUS', exit='$JF_EXITCODE')."
          if [[ -n "$JF_ERROR" ]]; then log_warning "Jellyfin error: $JF_ERROR"; fi
          log_warning "Likely NVIDIA CDI/driver/lib mismatch. See [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1)."
          log_info "Engaging automatic fallback to CPU mode (no-GPU compose)..."
          
          # Bring down GPU stack (ignore errors) then start no-GPU compose
          set +e
          $COMPOSE_CMD --env-file "$ENV_FILE" -f "$COMPOSE_FILE" down || true
          set -e
          ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE="core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml"
          if $COMPOSE_CMD --env-file "$ENV_FILE" -f "$ACTIVE_COMPOSE_FILE" up -d $SERVICES; then
              sleep 5
              set +e
              JF_AFTER="$(podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}}|{{.State.Error}}|{{.State.ExitCode}}' 2>/dev/null)"
              set -e
              JF_STATUS2="$(echo "$JF_AFTER" | cut -d'|' -f1)"
              JF_ERROR2="$(echo "$JF_AFTER" | cut -d'|' -f2)"
              JF_EXITCODE2="$(echo "$JF_AFTER" | cut -d'|' -f3)"
              if [[ "$JF_STATUS2" == "running" && ( -z "$JF_EXITCODE2" || "$JF_EXITCODE2" == "0" ) ]]; then
                  log_success "Fallback successful: Jellyfin running in CPU mode."
              else
                  log_warning "Fallback attempted; current Jellyfin state: status='$JF_STATUS2', exit='$JF_EXITCODE2'. Error: $JF_ERROR2"
              fi
          else
              log_error "Fallback failed: could not start no-GPU compose."
          fi
      else
          log_success "Jellyfin is running with GPU acceleration."
      fi
  fi
  ```
